content:
why's it a CoC? shouldn't it be a puzzle?

hmmm... naw, with a bunch of regexes the solution becomes tiny, so it's ok

Furthermore, there can be some other cases I can think about ; tell me if it is possible to encounter them and if there are legit/error tests please:

"answer something." (no write) -> "Syntax Error"
"You must write something." (something else before "write") -> "something"
"write something.  please" (something after write) -> "something"
"times write foo." (no number) -> "Syntax Error"
"X times write foo." (not a number) -> "Syntax Error"
"more than 2 times write bar." (something before n times) -> "bar\nbar"
"1 times or not write anything." (something between n times and write) -> "anything"
"please write something. 1 times after this" (something after n times) -> "something"
"write this 1 times." (dot after times) -> "this 1 times"
"1 times write 2 times." (several numbers or simply numbers in the output) -> "2 times"
"1 times 2 times write this." (several times) -> "Syntax Error"
"write write this." (several write) -> "write this"
"write Syntax Error." (printing... error :-P) -> "Syntax Error"
You should add that a dot at the end is mandatory to the command to be correct.
That would be a great reverse challenge.
Yes, I agree, it would be also good for shortest.
I know that it's not useful at all, we can write only the write function, but it's a way to validate the <<player's>> code
Yes you're right I'll do it, thank you!

I totally agree with your validating examples, but if I make it more complicated it will take a lot of time to accomplish. Thank you for the suggestion, I may add some of your examples. Have a nice day!

In fact, these examples match edge cases that need to be clarified.
Some of them change a lot the approach to tackle this puzzle (for example a choice between a simple split and an advanced regex).

That's true. Regex expressions would be much better to use, but the problem is that I will have to reset almost everything to make it as you said. If you want you can create another puzzle yourself. Sorry, and thanks for the help and suggestions.
I know that it would be harder for a CoC if "1 time" were used instead.
